title: Here come the Moon landing missions (probably)
summary: Three for NASA, and one each for India, Russia, and Japan.

title: Astranis to deliver GEO broadband satellite for the Philippines next year
summary: Astranis has sold a small broadband satellite launching to geostationary orbit next year to a telco in the Philippines looking for support from the country’s government, the Californian manufacturer announced July 11.

title: Launch Roundup: China to launch methane powered ZQ-2; SpaceX to finish Starlink v1 flights
summary: This week, LandSpace will attempt to reach orbit on its second test flight of the ZhuQue-2 rocket; SpaceX will launch the final v1.0/v1.5 Starlink satellites on Starlink Group 5-15; India will launch the Chandrayaan-3 lunar exploration mission atop their Launch Vehicle Mark 3 rocket; and Rocket Lab will launch its “Baby Come Back” mission, which will include recovery of its first stage.

title: India’s renewed effort toward space preeminence
summary: India’s flurry of technical and political space activities positions the state to become a preeminent space power. New domestic initiatives pave the way by resolving complex bureaucratic challenges. A series of civil and commercial partnerships with the United States build on this progress. To bolster its ascent, India must address remaining gaps in how it intends to govern the commercial-security nexus in space.

title: Former NASA astronaut to advise Vast on commercial space station efforts
summary: Vast Space has brought in a former NASA astronaut and SpaceX official to serve as an adviser for its plans to develop commercial space stations.

title: Astranis to bring satellite internet to 2 million people in the Philippines next year
summary: Astranis, a San Francisco-based company with an alternative approach to providing internet access from satellites, recently signed a deal to provide dedicated service to the Philippines, a first for the archipelago nation.

title: Muon wins option to monitor ionosphere for Space Force
summary: Muon Space will begin delivering space weather data to the U.S. Space Force under a $400,000 contract option announced July 11.

title: Thermal imagery sector heats up
summary: British investment firm Seraphim Space surveyed the Earth observation sector a few years ago, categorizing startups by sensor type. Analysts determined that firms focused on electro-optical and synthetic aperture radar […]

title: NASA awards “crossover” spacesuit task orders to Axiom and Collins
summary: WASHINGTON — NASA awarded task orders to two companies already working on spacesuits for the International Space Station and Artemis missions to develop alternative versions of their suits. NASA announced […]

title: Astra to raise up to $65 million in stock sale
summary: Faced with dwindling cash and a stock delisting, Astra Space announced plans July 10 to perform a reverse split of its stock and sell up to $65 million of it.
